---
title: Adaptive Themes
description: "Themes are built in, and adaptive by default."
---

---

Themes are a first class citizen in Potion and are adaptive by default.

When running the init command, a global.css file is created, as well as an updated tailwind.config. By doing that themes powered by CSS Variables can be installed and ready to use.

The idea behind adaptive theming is that setting a color to *bg-primary* via css variable will allow the color to be switched automatically depending on what theme is set!


## Default Themes

<div class="w-full max-h-96 overflow-y-auto no-scrollbar">
```bash
@tailwind base;
@tailwind components;
@tailwind utilities;

@layer base {

    --arrow-size: 12px;
```

</div>

## Conventions

The theme conventions consist of

1. surface(1-4) - used for backgrounds
2. border, input, focus
3. fg(1-6) - usually grays, use for foreground text hierarchy
4. primary(100-900) - your main brand color
5. secondary(100-900) - your secondary brand color
6. positive(100-900) - used to indicate things like success, positive trends, completions, etc.
7. warning(100-900) - used to draw caution
8. critical(100-900) - used to signal danger, or any type of descrutcive action

## Changing Themes

The themes are set via [data-theme="light"] [data-theme="dark"], etc.

A good way to change themes is to use a library like [Theme-change](https://github.com/saadeghi/theme-change) or [Next-Themes](https://github.com/pacocoursey/next-themes)
